Ali Ordered Items

Taken from the Wikipedia article: Erikson's Stages of Psychosocial Development

Erikson's stages of psychosocial development, as articulated by Erik Erikson, in collaboration with Joan Erikson,[1] is a comprehensive psychoanalytic theory that identifies a series of eight stages, in which a healthy developing individual should pass through from infancy to late adulthood.

Place Erikson's stages of psychosocial crisis in their correct order, from birth (1) to maturity (8).
